title: Booking Flights
description: For long distances, flights are the fastest option. Booking smartly can save you a significant amount of money and potential hassle.
sentences: For domestic travel, book flights at least 6-8 weeks in advance for better pricing.
Use search engines like Skyscanner or Google Flights to compare prices across all airlines.
Flights on weekdays (Tuesday, Wednesday) and at odd hours are often cheaper.
Always check the airline's baggage allowance to avoid expensive fees at the airport.
Web check-in is mandatory for most airlines now and saves a lot of time.
dos: Clear your browser cookies or use incognito mode when searching for flights to prevent price hikes.
Arrive at the airport at least 2 hours before your domestic flight's departure.
Keep your ID card and boarding pass (digital or physical) handy.
Check the flight's on-time performance history if possible.
donts: Don't book the very last flight of the day, as it has a higher chance of being delayed or cancelled.
Don't carry prohibited items like power banks in your check-in luggage.
Don't forget to factor in the cost of travel to and from the airport, which can be far from the city.
Don't book tickets with very short layovers, especially at large airports.
